story:
INTRODUCING:
THE WORLD´S BEST RECOVERY SANDAL!

WITH 24 FEATURES!

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________


Why the ´recoverToes´ is good for YOU!

Exercise such as running, hiking, an intense workout or just a long day on your feet, causes the muscles in your foot to fatigue, get sore and tighten up. The ´recoverToes´ recovery sandal has been biomechanically engineered to provide relief from these symptoms and decrease the risk of exercise related pain and injury.

By wearing the ´recoverToes´ recovery sandal regularly (home, office, garden, gym, …) you can speed up foot recovery after running or after a long day on your feet and minimize foot soreness while fixing your foot function with every step you take in them.

To be clear, however, these are not sandals that you are meant to wear while running. Rather, you should wear them only after a run.


THE SIMPLEST WAY TO FIX YOUR FOOT-PAIN

Studies show, that the muscular fatigue experienced after prolonged walking, exercise or running increases pressure on the forefoot and heel.


The biggest influence on foot-pain is the shape and structure of the toebox of the footwear habitually used in training and daily life.

CONVENTIONAL FOOTWEAR IS BAD FOR YOUR FEET:

The ´recoverToes´recovery sandal helps your foot to rehabilitate from the negative effects of years of wearing conventional footwear.  It works like braces for the teeth: it puts your big toe into an optimal alignment and thereby slowly and progressively changes the structure of the foot while easing high-pressure points.  This will help the muscles to adapt accordingly and support positive effects on biomechanics, gait and injury prevention.

*References below.

__________________________________________________________________________________________

MOST ADVANCED AND INNOVATIVE

__________________________________________________________________________________________

TOEFREEDOM®: Our secret Ingredient

__________________________________________________________________________________________

The ToeRite Technology  

(patent pending) 

Improve at your own pace

We usually spend decades in conventional footwear, that is too narrow at the front.  Our feet become shoe-shaped with squished toes that can no longer function naturally. The ToeRite technology (patent pending) works like braces for the teeth: it puts your big toe into an optimal alignment and thereby slowly and progressively changes the structure of the foot.  This will help the muscles to adapt accordingly and support positive effects on biomechanics, gait and injury prevention.

 

The ´recoverToes´ can easily be customized by yourself to fit the unique situation of your feet. It automatically comes with three sizes of additional ToeRite clips (patent pending) that can be used to widen the ToeRite mechanism . We recommend you start wearing the ´recoverToes´ consistently and progressively without any of the additional clips at least for a period 3 months, before adding one of the additional clips. After that period, if needed, you can add the next size of clips to create a wider spread of the big toe. This will help to gradually re-align your big toe to its natural position and support the natural function of your big toe to anchor and stabilize the foot.

Switching your ToeRite clips is easy:

It´s very easy to switch between the three sizes of clips that come automatically with your ´recoverToes´.  They´re also easy to wash.

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

Wear them anywhere

High quality PU: water and moisture proof!

__________________________________________________________________________________________

Comparison and Specs

__________________________________________________________________________________________


__________________________________________________________________________________________

Biomechanically validated

Your feet are in good hands

The ´recoverToes´ recovery sandal is brought to you from Germany with a combined know-how of over 50 years in footwear and biomechanics. We  leveraged our experience - including the assessment of thousands of runners feet worldwid - and our relentless passion and commitment to function and design, to create a sandal that helps rehabilitate and maintain your foot-function.

SEBASTIAN BÄR
SHOE PIONEER AND INVENTOR OF THE FUNCTIONAL FOOTWEAR DESIGN CONCEPT
Sebastian´s family has been making shoes with toefreedom® for over three decades.  His experience of helping people all around the world to improve their foot function through the benefits of toefreedom® and his passion for running has led him to create the Functional Footwear Design Concept.

LEE SAXBY
BIOMECHANIST, RUNNING COACH AND CREATOR​ OF THE FUNCTIONAL FOOTMAP.
Lee is one of the most recognised coaches for running technique on an international level.  
His knowledge and experience in running biomechanics and foot function has benefited injured runners, both recreational and elite around the globe and led him to develop the Functional FootMap assessment system.

_________________________________________________________________________________________

The Science

DR WILKINSON
Dr Wilkinson´s research area is the biology of human health and performance. His work has included the biomechanics and performance determinants of distance running and the link between plantar sensation and regulation of bipedal gait.  He has a particular interest in the influence of footwear on foot structure, function and joint loading during running.

 

Recovery footwear: a science-based solution to post-running lower-limb and foot pain.
“When our feet hurt, we hurt all over”
Socrates.

Distance running is a popular pursuit [1] characterised by repeated absorption of loads as high as three times body weight with each step [2]. Increased participation is mirrored by increased injury rates [3], more than 90% of which are to the lower limbs and feet [4].

The stability, shock absorption and propulsive functions of the foot directly influence the risk of such injuries [5,6]. Prolonged weight bearing exercise like hiking and running can fatigue muscles controlling these functions, resulting in pain during and after exercise and increased injury risk [7,8,9]. As lower limb and toe flexor muscles weaken, stabilising pressure exerted by the toes falls, and painful areas of high pressure develop under the metatarsals [7,8]. The stabilising function of the toes during weight bearing depends on their structural alignment and the strength and endurance of the flexor muscles that press them into the ground [10-14]. Habitual use of shoes with a narrow toe box and toe spring compromises alignment and muscle function [15-17]. A narrow toe box compresses the great toe and elevates the first metatarsal head producing hallux valgus deformity [15,16] and an unstable foot [11,18,19]. A toe spring hyperextends the toe joints, which weakens intrinsic muscles that flatten the toes against the ground, while increasing the dominance of extrinsic toe muscles that produce the claw reflex and hammer toe deformity [10,17].

Recovery from prolonged weight bearing exercise must involve relief of the high pressures under the metatarsals resulting from fatigue, restoration of great toe alignment and the stabilising/load bearing function of the first metatarsal, and return of the strength and function of intrinsic muscles controlling the lesser toes. The habitual-everyday use of recovery footwear engineered to relieve pain and restore function is the best way to address symptoms and their root cause, thereby regaining functional feet and the enjoyment pain-free movement.

*References below.

__________________________________________________________________________________________

READY TO BACK THIS PROJECT?

Follow these simple steps!

__________________________________________________________________________________________

How to find the right size

Please note, that with a sandal and the open heel, the fitting will not be the same as in a shoe and will give you a bit more room. The sandal does run a bit big, so if you like your fit a bit more snug, choose the smaller size. If you like normal to a bit looser fit, choose your normal size.

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

Social Media

You can find more information about Joe Nimble here:
Joe Nimble on the web: https://joe-nimble.com/int
Joe Nimble on Facebook: www.facebook.com/joenimbleDE
Joe Nimble on Instagram: www.instagram.com/joenimble
Joe Nimble on YouTube: https://bit.ly/2Q1EJVV
Joe Nimble Blog: https://www.joe-nimble.com/int/explore/the-scie...
myFoot education: http://myFoot.com

__________________________________________________________________________________________

References

  1. International Amateur Athletics Federation. The state of Running 2019. Available at https://runrepeat.com/state-of-running.
  2. Nilsson J and Thorstensson A. Ground reaction forces at different speed of human walking and running. Acta Physiol Scand 1989; 136: 217-227.
  3. van Gent RN, Siem D, van Middlekoop M, van Os AG, Bierma-Zeinstra SMA, Koes BW. Incidence and determinants of lower extremity running injuries in long distance runners: a systematic review. Br J Sports Med 2007; 41: 469-480.
  4. Marti B, Vader JP, Minder CE, Abelin T. On the epidemiology of running injuries. The 1984 Bern Grand-Prix study. Am J Sports Med 1988; 16: 285-294.
  5. Vorobiev G. Evolution of injuries in athletics. New Stud Ath 1999; 4: 23-26.
  6. Williams DS, McClay IS, Hamill J. Arch structure and injury patterns in runners. Clin Biomech 2001; 16: 314-347.
  7. Nagel A, Fernholz F, Kibele C, Rosenbaum D. Long distance running increases plantar pressures beneath the metatarsal heads: A barefoot walking investigation of 200 marathon runners. Gait Posture 2008; 27: 152-155.
  8. Voloshin AS, Mizrahi J, Verbitsky O, Isakov E. Dynamic loading on the human musculoskeletal system – effect of fatigue. Clin Biomech 1998; 13: 515-520.
  9. Keijsers NLW, Stolwijk NM, Louwerens JWK, Duysens J. Classification of forefoot pain based on plantar pressure measurements. Clin Biom 2013; 28: 350-356.
  10. Lambrinudi C. The feet of the industrial worker. Lancet 1938; 24: 1450.
  11. Morton DJ. The Human Foot: Its evolution, physiology and functional disorders. London: Oxford University Press 1935.
  12. D'Aout K, Pataky TC, De Clercq D, Aerts P. The effects of habitual footwear use: foot shape and function in native barefoot walkers. Footwear Sci 2009; 1:81-94.
  13. Mei Q, Fernandez J, Fu W, Feng N, Gu Y. A comparative biomechanical analysis of habitually unshod and shod runners based on foot morphological difference. Hum Movement Sci 2015; 42:3 8-53.
  14. Hamel AJ, Donahue SW, Sharkey NA. Contributions of active and passive toe flexion to forefoot loading. Clin Ortho Rel Res 2001; 393: 326-334.
  15. Munteanu SE, Menz HB, Wark JD, Christie JJ, Scurrah KJ, Bui M, Erbas B, Hopper JL, Wluka AE: Hallux valgus, by nature or nurture? A twin study. Arth Care & Res 2017; 69: 1421-1428.
  16. Nix S, Smith M, Vicenzino B: Prevalence of hallux valgus in the general population: a systematic review and meta-analysis. J Foot Ankle Res 2010; 3: 21.
  17. Sichting F, Holowka NB, Hansen OB, Lieberman DE. Effect of the upward curvature of toe springs on walking biomechanics in humans. Nature 2020; 10; 14643. DOI: 10.1038/s41598-020-71247-9.
  18. Yavuz M, Hetherington VJ, Botek G, Hirschman GB, Bardsley L, Davis BL. Forefoot plantar shear stress distribution in hallux valgus patients. Gait Pos 2009; 30: 257-9.
  19. Plank M. The pattern of forefoot pressure distribution in hallux valgus. Foot 1995; 5: 8-14.
story_txt:
INTRODUCING:THE WORLD´S BEST RECOVERY SANDAL!WITH 24 FEATURES!____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Why the ´recoverToes´ is good for YOU!Exercise such as running, hiking, an intense workout or just a long day on your feet, causes the muscles in your foot to fatigue, get sore and tighten up. The ´recoverToes´ recovery sandal has been biomechanically engineered to provide relief from these symptoms and decrease the risk of exercise related pain and injury.By wearing the ´recoverToes´ recovery sandal regularly (home, office, garden, gym, …) you can speed up foot recovery after running or after a long day on your feet and minimize foot soreness while fixing your foot function with every step you take in them.To be clear, however, these are not sandals that you are meant to wear while running. Rather, you should wear them only after a run.
THE SIMPLEST WAY TO FIX YOUR FOOT-PAINStudies show, that the muscular fatigue experienced after prolonged walking, exercise or running increases pressure on the forefoot and heel.The biggest influence on foot-pain is the shape and structure of the toebox of the footwear habitually used in training and daily life.CONVENTIONAL FOOTWEAR IS BAD FOR YOUR FEET:The ´recoverToes´recovery sandal helps your foot to rehabilitate from the negative effects of years of wearing conventional footwear.  It works like braces for the teeth: it puts your big toe into an optimal alignment and thereby slowly and progressively changes the structure of the foot while easing high-pressure points.  This will help the muscles to adapt accordingly and support positive effects on biomechanics, gait and injury prevention.*References below.__________________________________________________________________________________________MOST ADVANCED AND INNOVATIVE__________________________________________________________________________________________TOEFREEDOM®: Our secret Ingredient__________________________________________________________________________________________The ToeRite Technology  
(patent pending) Improve at your own paceWe usually spend decades in conventional footwear, that is too narrow at the front.  Our feet become shoe-shaped with squished toes that can no longer function naturally. The ToeRite technology (patent pending) works like braces for the teeth: it puts your big toe into an optimal alignment and thereby slowly and progressively changes the structure of the foot.  This will help the muscles to adapt accordingly and support positive effects on biomechanics, gait and injury prevention. The ´recoverToes´ can easily be customized by yourself to fit the unique situation of your feet. It automatically comes with three sizes of additional ToeRite clips (patent pending) that can be used to widen the ToeRite mechanism . We recommend you start wearing the ´recoverToes´ consistently and progressively without any of the additional clips at least for a period 3 months, before adding one of the additional clips. After that period, if needed, you can add the next size of clips to create a wider spread of the big toe. This will help to gradually re-align your big toe to its natural position and support the natural function of your big toe to anchor and stabilize the foot.Switching your ToeRite clips is easy:It´s very easy to switch between the three sizes of clips that come automatically with your ´recoverToes´.  They´re also easy to wash.____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________Wear them anywhereHigh quality PU: water and moisture proof!__________________________________________________________________________________________Comparison and Specs____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________Biomechanically validatedYour feet are in good handsThe ´recoverToes´ recovery sandal is brought to you from Germany with a combined know-how of over 50 years in footwear and biomechanics. We  leveraged our experience - including the assessment of thousands of runners feet worldwid - and our relentless passion and commitment to function and design, to create a sandal that helps rehabilitate and maintain your foot-function.SEBASTIAN BÄRSHOE PIONEER AND INVENTOR OF THE FUNCTIONAL FOOTWEAR DESIGN CONCEPTSebastian´s family has been making shoes with toefreedom® for over three decades.  His experience of helping people all around the world to improve their foot function through the benefits of toefreedom® and his passion for running has led him to create the Functional Footwear Design Concept.LEE SAXBYBIOMECHANIST, RUNNING COACH AND CREATOR​ OF THE FUNCTIONAL FOOTMAP.Lee is one of the most recognised coaches for running technique on an international level.  His knowledge and experience in running biomechanics and foot function has benefited injured runners, both recreational and elite around the globe and led him to develop the Functional FootMap assessment system._________________________________________________________________________________________The Science


DR WILKINSONDr Wilkinson´s research area is the biology of human health and performance. His work has included the biomechanics and performance determinants of distance running and the link between plantar sensation and regulation of bipedal gait.  He has a particular interest in the influence of footwear on foot structure, function and joint loading during running. Recovery footwear: a science-based solution to post-running lower-limb and foot pain.“When our feet hurt, we hurt all over”Socrates.Distance running is a popular pursuit [1] characterised by repeated absorption of loads as high as three times body weight with each step [2]. Increased participation is mirrored by increased injury rates [3], more than 90% of which are to the lower limbs and feet [4].The stability, shock absorption and propulsive functions of the foot directly influence the risk of such injuries [5,6]. Prolonged weight bearing exercise like hiking and running can fatigue muscles controlling these functions, resulting in pain during and after exercise and increased injury risk [7,8,9]. As lower limb and toe flexor muscles weaken, stabilising pressure exerted by the toes falls, and painful areas of high pressure develop under the metatarsals [7,8]. The stabilising function of the toes during weight bearing depends on their structural alignment and the strength and endurance of the flexor muscles that press them into the ground [10-14]. Habitual use of shoes with a narrow toe box and toe spring compromises alignment and muscle function [15-17]. A narrow toe box compresses the great toe and elevates the first metatarsal head producing hallux valgus deformity [15,16] and an unstable foot [11,18,19]. A toe spring hyperextends the toe joints, which weakens intrinsic muscles that flatten the toes against the ground, while increasing the dominance of extrinsic toe muscles that produce the claw reflex and hammer toe deformity [10,17].Recovery from prolonged weight bearing exercise must involve relief of the high pressures under the metatarsals resulting from fatigue, restoration of great toe alignment and the stabilising/load bearing function of the first metatarsal, and return of the strength and function of intrinsic muscles controlling the lesser toes. The habitual-everyday use of recovery footwear engineered to relieve pain and restore function is the best way to address symptoms and their root cause, thereby regaining functional feet and the enjoyment pain-free movement.*References below.__________________________________________________________________________________________READY TO BACK THIS PROJECT?Follow these simple steps!__________________________________________________________________________________________How to find the right sizePlease note, that with a sandal and the open heel, the fitting will not be the same as in a shoe and will give you a bit more room. The sandal does run a bit big, so if you like your fit a bit more snug, choose the smaller size. If you like normal to a bit looser fit, choose your normal size.____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________Social MediaYou can find more information about Joe Nimble here:Joe Nimble on the web: https://joe-nimble.com/intJoe Nimble on Facebook: www.facebook.com/joenimbleDEJoe Nimble on Instagram: www.instagram.com/joenimbleJoe Nimble on YouTube: https://bit.ly/2Q1EJVVJoe Nimble Blog: https://www.joe-nimble.com/int/explore/the-scie...myFoot education: http://myFoot.com__________________________________________________________________________________________References
International Amateur Athletics Federation. The state of Running 2019. Available at https://runrepeat.com/state-of-running.
Nilsson J and Thorstensson A. Ground reaction forces at different speed of human walking and running. Acta Physiol Scand 1989; 136: 217-227.
van Gent RN, Siem D, van Middlekoop M, van Os AG, Bierma-Zeinstra SMA, Koes BW. Incidence and determinants of lower extremity running injuries in long distance runners: a systematic review. Br J Sports Med 2007; 41: 469-480.
Marti B, Vader JP, Minder CE, Abelin T. On the epidemiology of running injuries. The 1984 Bern Grand-Prix study. Am J Sports Med 1988; 16: 285-294.
Vorobiev G. Evolution of injuries in athletics. New Stud Ath 1999; 4: 23-26.
Williams DS, McClay IS, Hamill J. Arch structure and injury patterns in runners. Clin Biomech 2001; 16: 314-347.
Nagel A, Fernholz F, Kibele C, Rosenbaum D. Long distance running increases plantar pressures beneath the metatarsal heads: A barefoot walking investigation of 200 marathon runners. Gait Posture 2008; 27: 152-155.
Voloshin AS, Mizrahi J, Verbitsky O, Isakov E. Dynamic loading on the human musculoskeletal system – effect of fatigue. Clin Biomech 1998; 13: 515-520.
Keijsers NLW, Stolwijk NM, Louwerens JWK, Duysens J. Classification of forefoot pain based on plantar pressure measurements. Clin Biom 2013; 28: 350-356.
Lambrinudi C. The feet of the industrial worker. Lancet 1938; 24: 1450.
Morton DJ. The Human Foot: Its evolution, physiology and functional disorders. London: Oxford University Press 1935.
D'Aout K, Pataky TC, De Clercq D, Aerts P. The effects of habitual footwear use: foot shape and function in native barefoot walkers. Footwear Sci 2009; 1:81-94.
Mei Q, Fernandez J, Fu W, Feng N, Gu Y. A comparative biomechanical analysis of habitually unshod and shod runners based on foot morphological difference. Hum Movement Sci 2015; 42:3 8-53.
Hamel AJ, Donahue SW, Sharkey NA. Contributions of active and passive toe flexion to forefoot loading. Clin Ortho Rel Res 2001; 393: 326-334.
Munteanu SE, Menz HB, Wark JD, Christie JJ, Scurrah KJ, Bui M, Erbas B, Hopper JL, Wluka AE: Hallux valgus, by nature or nurture? A twin study. Arth Care & Res 2017; 69: 1421-1428.
Nix S, Smith M, Vicenzino B: Prevalence of hallux valgus in the general population: a systematic review and meta-analysis. J Foot Ankle Res 2010; 3: 21.
Sichting F, Holowka NB, Hansen OB, Lieberman DE. Effect of the upward curvature of toe springs on walking biomechanics in humans. Nature 2020; 10; 14643. DOI: 10.1038/s41598-020-71247-9.
Yavuz M, Hetherington VJ, Botek G, Hirschman GB, Bardsley L, Davis BL. Forefoot plantar shear stress distribution in hallux valgus patients. Gait Pos 2009; 30: 257-9.
Plank M. The pattern of forefoot pressure distribution in hallux valgus. Foot 1995; 5: 8-14.

story:
Help us reach our stretch goal of £30k to unlock an additional colourway for Wype Refill!

The final colourway will be voted on by our backers.

Too much toilet talk?

Tickle your senses with our funding goal celebratory limited edition candle!

This Smells Like My Bum... inspired by clean booty, warm from a nap under a cozy duvet and crisp sheets.⁠

Top notes: Orange, Bergamot & Pear. Middle: Rose, Geranium & Violet. Base: Patchouli, Vanilla & Sandalwood.⁠
⁠
Let the fruity top notes tease you, while the floral middle notes surround you in a gentle and powdery bliss. Finally the sweet woody base notes round the scent out and bring it home, like your favourite spot on the sofa. You know the one, and so does your tush.
⁠
Proudly made in the UK out of 220gm of quality vegan soy wax, and will burn for around 40 hours.⁠

 

Simply apply our natural cleansing gel to regular toilet paper, wipe 'til you're satisfied, then flush!

Our gel is hypoallergenic, 100% flushable and biodegradable. 

 

4.7 on Trustpilot (as of June 2021)

Wype Refill was always going to be our Hero product, but we wanted to make sure we got it right. We launched Wype gel in September, our off-the-shelf applicator and first formulation to help us understand what we needed to do to make Wype Refill perfect! Wype gel is now in more than 15,000 bathrooms in the UK and worldwide, and we've used this to learn what our customers do and don't like, so you know that we have some experience below our belts!

We are SO excited about Wype Refill, and hope you will want to come on this journey with us!

Keep the applicator, recycle our infinitely recyclable aluminium bottle, and go about your day with a clean bum and a cleaner conscience!

The majority of wipes are made with plastic resins like polyester or polypropylene. You won’t see that written on the package though, because most brands only list the ingredients of the liquid that moistens the fabric.

So what happens to wet wipes when you throw them away?

They either end up in landfill, where it takes up to 100 years for them to break down, or littered, as you might have noticed on camping trips and long hikes, and finally, flushed, where they end up entering our waterways and blocking our sewers.

Even when wet wipes manage to break down, they shed fibres and slowly break down into microplastics, polluting land, rivers and oceans, and entering wildlife and human food chains.

Flushing wet wipes down the toilet is polluting, and no-one wants to be a polluter.

________________________________________________________________________________________

    

________________________________________________________________________________________

 

A patent-pending design, made for efficiency and convenience.

Our dispenser was designed specifically to spread the formula evenly on tissue. The gel is dispersed through six holes on the applicator head. Once the gel is released, all you need to do is fold or scrunch your tissue, and gently glide the paper onto the dispenser.

So easy to use, you could do it with one hand behind your back.

In fact, we encourage you to do so! When you want one hand to take care of business without the other getting in the way, or simply you don't like the idea of cross-contamination - rest assured, Wype Refill was designed to be used single-handed. 

No need for your Wype Refill to touch the floor.

Not all floors are clean, and you might not want to share the bottom of your Wype Refill with all the grime that can be found on the ground of a public bathroom. That's why we ensured that our applicator would have a trusty loop, so that you can stay above it all, quite literally.

Our aluminium refills are infinitely recyclable, and easy to replace.

Once your refill is empty, simply unscrew it from the applicator and swap it in for a new one. Not only are our refills infinitely recyclable, but 75% of all the aluminium ever produced to date is still in use today!

Our new formula is COSMOS natural certified.

Which means that all of our ingredients are approved by the soil association. Our formula is pH balanced (suitable for external use on the vulva), hypoallergenic and dermatologically approved for sensitive skin and newborns. It is also certified Vegan and Cruelty Free.

It's been a long time coming but now we're on a roll...

We've been working on this project for 18 months now, and we know that Wype works and has already helped thousands make the switch from wet wipes.

With your support we can achieve so much more!

The Wype Refill Dream Team

We've talked about them, posted about them, yelled about them in the streets... Our applicator equipped with its infinitely recyclable aluminium refill, for a bum that says "I love the planet".

Bhoodie & Tush-irt

We want our backers to look great while saving the planet from their toilet seat... so we got in touch with some old friends from Giorgia's days in fashion to help us design a graphic for our Wype Bhoodie and Tush-irt that makes the ultimate 'I heart my clean bottom' statement. As the sleeve of the Bhoodie states..."It's a thing of booty"!

Buy an applicator, and we'll plant a tree! 

Yes, cleaning backsides is our vocation, but at the same time we do want to give mother nature some love. For the birth of Wype Refill, we thought there would be nothing more appropriate than planting some trees.

Wype is still like a little sprout, and we want to make sure that we give back every time that someone believes in us. So, every time one of our applicators is purchased, we will plant a tree thanks to our friends at treeapp.

Something unique for our super backers

Did we mention that our co-founder Giorgia is an incredibly talented artist? Well she'll be putting her artistic skills to good use for our biggest supporters! Gio is working on a series of 'Majestic Bums from the Animal Kingdom' to remind you of how magnificent you are by backing us with your backside. Starting with Potty the Peacock (see below), the illustrations are ink on paper, with the final design and size to be discussed with each individual super backer.

Hang them on your bathroom wall, or imagine what words might have going through Giorgia's head while drawing the 60th peacock feather...

So without further ado, here are our perks!

When I (Giorgia) moved from Italy to the UK, I was desperately missing her bidet - I simply didn't feel clean! I quickly learned that the majority of people who felt this way had a handy pack of wipes tucked away somewhere around their bathroom.  I found out that wipes (historically a recent invention) are extremely harmful for the environment.

While I wanted to be able to feel clean on-the-go, I just couldn't accept to be a part of the damage that wipes and other unflushables were causing. Eli and I teamed up and decided to do something about it. We wanted to make a product so easy and convenient to use, that it would seamlessly enter anyone's bathroom routine without disrupting it, and so off we went...

Many different ideas were explored before our final design was chosen, we wanted to really understand how we could be as unintrusive as possible, while improving your bathroom experience.

Some of the finalists, none of them made the final cut, as we ultimately went with a hybrid!

Now we're working with our manufacturer and making sure that Wype Refill is ready to go in October!

Risks & Challenges

We want to be completely upfront with our backers and let you know exactly where we're up to, and what the main risks are for the product!

  • As of launch day, we have a finalised, fully functioning and tested design.
  • We have functional 3D printed prototypes of our design.
  • The next step in the manufacturing process is to create the tooling (moulds) that will mass produce the applicator! This will start in early-mid June and take 4-6 weeks, and will include testing and adjustment to make sure the quality is of the highest standard.
  • Once the tooling is complete, adjusted, and manufacturing Wype Refill to the standard that we expect, we can begin manufacture, which we anticipate to start in August!
  • Meanwhile, we will be manufacturing our aluminium refills and merch!
  • We expect all our components to be with us in mid-September, to then fill the refills with our gel, put everything together, and ship it out to you!
  • There are of course chances of delays throughout these steps, however we are in daily contact with out manufacturers and design team, and we are confident that as things currently stand, we will be able to deliver Wype Refill in October!

story:
Reach your weight and fitness goals faster. Get diet & workout plans based on your body's needs.

 

 

Smarter weight management starts with Intriex

 


 

 

 Hormone analysis to kickstart your weight loss journey 

 Using all three indexes and hormone analysis, Intriex creates your diet plan, workout routine, and long-term map for smarter weight management. With the Seein Intriex app, you can access easy-to-understand results, share data, and acquire actionable insights anytime. 

 

 

 

 

Personalized workout plans

Intriex’s professional workouts will put you on the fast track to success. Get feedback on your physical performance based on your resting metabolic rate and body fat levels. Know how to optimize your routine so you can build muscles and burn fat effectively.

 

 

 

Know what to eat

Discover the best foods that work for your metabolism, and see what's keeping you from reaching your health goals.

 The Seein Intriex app will coach your lifestyle, letting you know exactly what to eat. Enjoy personalized meal plans and tasty recipes based on your resting metabolic rate and ketone levels.

 

 

Snap a picture to track nutritional needs 

Easily track your meal’s nutrition by taking a photo of your food. Check if you have enough carbs, protein, and fat for a balanced diet and get feedback on your meal plans, giving you a full view of how your choices impact your life.

 

Set fitness goals for your family

Share Intriex with loved ones and reach your health goals together! Intriex makes it easy to keep everyone motivated and on track. Create profiles for each family member. You’ll unlock fun fitness plans and delicious, nutritious recipes the whole family can enjoy.

 

No need to send samples to a lab or spend time at the doctor’s.

Intriex is a seamless experience you'll look forward to — anytime, anywhere. 

See Intriex in Action

 

Vitro Diagnostic Technology

We use Vitro Diagnostic Technology to detect hormones present in your saliva and urine (biomarkers) within minutes. Since saliva and urine are reliable biological fluids, you’ll get the most accurate assessment of your hormones in relation to your metabolism. Vitro Diagnostic Technology works by inserting your collected sample and test strip into the Seein stabilizer, where it will process and analyze your fluid and give a clear picture of your metabolic health. 

 

 

Metabolic Hormone Test 

See how thyroid hormones, cortisol, testosterone, and insulin affect your metabolism, energy levels, or changes in your weight, appetite, or physical performance. You may find this test beneficial if you’re interested in losing weight, building muscles, or boosting your fitness performance. 

Fat & Ketone Test

See how leptin, irisin, and ketones affect body fat, appetite, and energy. Consider taking this test if you’re interested in following the keto diet, want to know if you’re in ketosis, or want to know more about your body fat levels.

 

How to understand my results?

 

You’ll get detailed information about your hormone levels and how they affect everything from muscle building to calorie burning.

Intriex will also provide guidance and suggestions that help you sustain energy, burn extra calories, and reduce body fat. You’ll also discover which foods have the most impact on your ketone and blood glucose levels, so you’ll know exactly what to eat to lose weight.

 

 

 

 

Earn 10% CashBack

 

 

Be rewarded with 10% commission of every dollar you help raise for our campaign! All you have to do is:

1. Click HERE and register as a Booster.

2. Share your unique Booster link on your Facebook, Twitter, Blog, Website, or wherever you'd like!

3. Refer to your Kickbooster dashboard and watch your commissions roll in!

 

 

Our qualified team of scientists and doctors have spent countless hours testing Intriex to ensure reliability and accuracy. 

We have conducted multiple external and internal validation studies on the Intreix device and test how metabolic biomarkers are related to weight loss, physical exercise, and fat loss. Our lab test results show that our measurement is highly correlative with Elisa and CLIA method.

 

 

With over ten years of experience in research and development of health wearable devices, Derek is responsible for production and project management. Derek believes that at-home tests should revolve around what he calls the "3 Es" (Easy, Efficient, Effective). His passion for better health enabled him to design a smarter and more convenient method for weight loss. 

 

Gregg graduated from the University of Phoenix in Arizona, majoring in business management. Gregg has extensive experience in marketing and sales management. He has served as a sales director and other important positions in many well-known companies.

 

Kevin plays a key role in test kit development and optimization. Moreover, he performs technical laboratory processes, such as molecular cloning, biomarker expression, protein purification, crystallization, and analysis.

 

With multidisciplinary R & D experiences, Dr. Gong contributes to designing and synthesizing polymeric materials, ambient energy harvesting, and management in our group.

 

 

 

With ten years of research and development experience in wearable health devices, Dr. Chen Song, Ph.D., started Seein Health to accelerate the health evaluation process and develop technology that improves people's lives.

Growing up, Dr. Song saw firsthand how his parents struggled with their health providers and how so many others grappled with doctors and time-consuming lab tests.

Dr. Song formed a team of researchers and physicians and developed a way to make lab testing more accessible and affordable for all. Years of hard work and beta testing led to a new device that can track and measure one's metabolic health in the comfort of their home while providing a comprehensive plan for maintaining a healthy weight.

 

Our mission

 

At Seein Health, our mission is to enhance the health and quality of life of every person. We believe that knowing your metabolism is the key to understanding your body better. Using science and advanced technology, we're focused on providing access to accurate and easy-to-understand lab results for anyone looking to transform their health.

 

 

 

Shipping to United States (excluding Hawaii, Alaska, and minor outlying islands), Canada and Hong Kong is free. We charge an additional $10 shipping fees for orders in Australia, Austria, Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, Mexico, Malaysia, Netherlands, Norway, New Zealand, Singapore, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Thailand, and United Kingdom. Shipping fees to United Arab Emirates, Israel, Brazil is $15.

 

When we start shipping?

We expect to ship the product to backers in January-February 2021. We will keep you up to date on our progress and the expected delivery date of your order. 

 

 

This crowdfunding project is marketed by Red Cube. Since 2015, Red Cube has helped companies of all sizes bring their ideas into fruition, raising over $100MM through crowdfunding.

 

This device is used for weight management. It can’t be used in the diagnosis of a disease or as a determination of the state of health to cure, treat, prevent, or mitigate a disease.

 

Safety steps for a safe delivery

We're fully committed to delivering your products on time. We're also taking the necessary steps to protect our incredible fulfillment team's health and safety during this COVID reality. 

Steps we’re taking:

  • Distribution centers taking extensive precautions to ensure the safety of its workers. 
  • Providing team members with high-quality face masks and gloves to wear at work. 
  • Encouraging healthy hygiene habits as guided by the CDC.

 

We’re on track for safe delivery 

COVID-19 has had zero effect on our production, thanks to proper planning and safety measures. With an expanded team of great people to support the launch, we’re confident we can address any complications that come up. We’ve already started the manufacturing and production process, and we plan to ship Intriex beginning December 2020. We don't foresee any issues currently with this timeline. However, if by chance anything unexpected happens, we promise to keep you informed, both during the campaign and afterward.
story_txt:
Reach your weight and fitness goals faster. Get diet & workout plans based on your body's needs.  Smarter weight management starts with Intriex 
   Hormone analysis to kickstart your weight loss journey  Using all three indexes and hormone analysis, Intriex creates your diet plan, workout routine, and long-term map for smarter weight management. With the Seein Intriex app, you can access easy-to-understand results, share data, and acquire actionable insights anytime.     Personalized workout plansIntriex’s professional workouts will put you on the fast track to success. Get feedback on your physical performance based on your resting metabolic rate and body fat levels. Know how to optimize your routine so you can build muscles and burn fat effectively.   Know what to eatDiscover the best foods that work for your metabolism, and see what's keeping you from reaching your health goals. The Seein Intriex app will coach your lifestyle, letting you know exactly what to eat. Enjoy personalized meal plans and tasty recipes based on your resting metabolic rate and ketone levels.  Snap a picture to track nutritional needs Easily track your meal’s nutrition by taking a photo of your food. Check if you have enough carbs, protein, and fat for a balanced diet and get feedback on your meal plans, giving you a full view of how your choices impact your life. Set fitness goals for your familyShare Intriex with loved ones and reach your health goals together! Intriex makes it easy to keep everyone motivated and on track. Create profiles for each family member. You’ll unlock fun fitness plans and delicious, nutritious recipes the whole family can enjoy. 

No need to send samples to a lab or spend time at the doctor’s.
Intriex is a seamless experience you'll look forward to — anytime, anywhere. 

See Intriex in Action


 Vitro Diagnostic TechnologyWe use Vitro Diagnostic Technology to detect hormones present in your saliva and urine (biomarkers) within minutes. Since saliva and urine are reliable biological fluids, you’ll get the most accurate assessment of your hormones in relation to your metabolism. Vitro Diagnostic Technology works by inserting your collected sample and test strip into the Seein stabilizer, where it will process and analyze your fluid and give a clear picture of your metabolic health.   Metabolic Hormone Test See how thyroid hormones, cortisol, testosterone, and insulin affect your metabolism, energy levels, or changes in your weight, appetite, or physical performance. You may find this test beneficial if you’re interested in losing weight, building muscles, or boosting your fitness performance. Fat & Ketone TestSee how leptin, irisin, and ketones affect body fat, appetite, and energy. Consider taking this test if you’re interested in following the keto diet, want to know if you’re in ketosis, or want to know more about your body fat levels. How to understand my results? You’ll get detailed information about your hormone levels and how they affect everything from muscle building to calorie burning.Intriex will also provide guidance and suggestions that help you sustain energy, burn extra calories, and reduce body fat. You’ll also discover which foods have the most impact on your ketone and blood glucose levels, so you’ll know exactly what to eat to lose weight.

story:
NOW SHIPPING: Our first campaign backers are enjoying the benefits of their FlexBeam.
 

 

 

Light at specific red and near-infrared wavelengths is clinically proven to trigger a physiological healing response in the body.

Since the Nobel Prize-winning work of Niels Finsen in 1903, the effects of Red Light Therapy have been well documented in thousands of peer-reviewed studies, including extensive NASA research (see references at bottom of page).

 

We have taken this powerful technology a big step further and created a state-of-the-art device that can be used by anyone, anytime, anywhere.

 

 

Red light therapy works by stimulating your body's natural self-healing process.

FlexBeam offers a targeted application of red and infrared light, which works directly where it's needed and also generates vital systemic effects for the whole body.

 

 

Red Light triggers the mitochondria to produce more Adenosine Triphosphate (ATP), Reactive Oxygen Species (ROS), and Nitric Oxide (NO), all crucially involved in the body's healing process.

 

“Since using my FlexBeam I am amazed at how little knocks that used to linger for ages, seem to disappear almost immediately after only one treatment! Rugby is such a physical game, especially in my position, so it is important that when I go onto the field that I am not carrying any aches or pains and FlexBeam makes sure this is possible.”

 

“I was a keen runner until I injured my left quad muscle and suffered chronic inflammation and sharp shooting pain. After one treatment with FlexBeam, the pain reduced so significantly that I couldn’t believe it was possible! After 2 months of treatment, the pain and swelling are completely gone. I am running again and I don’t feel any pain at all! What an absolutely amazing and life changing device!”

 

“After dislocating my shoulder in a rock climbing accident, I could barely lift my shoulder and had significant pain. Using FlexBeam for about 5 weeks now has improved my flexibility to where I can lift my arm straight over my head, with full range of motion. It also greatly helped with pain.”

 

“After using FlexBeam, my muscle soreness and lower back pain massively decreased. My sleep quality also improved and I was waking up feeling refreshed and in less pain! I was actually really surprised that after just a couple sessions I felt physically and mentally better.”

 

FlexBeam is different from any red light therapy device ever invented.

Designed for the human body - for ultimate flexibility, efficiency and usability.

This is next-generation red light therapy: clinically proven, safe and easy to use.

 

Anyone. FlexBeam is a health optimization device with lots of applications.

It’s your workout buddy, preparing for exercise and improving recovery.

Your home health care device for treating pains, aches, injuries, wounds.

Your mindfulness mate for relaxing and recharging your body. And so much more.

No wonder it’s already a favorite of athletes, trainers, therapists and biohackers worldwide.

 

Our team has worked on FlexBeam for almost three years. It has gone through ten working models, four prototype stages, and several rounds of clinical testing before becoming perfected in our own ISO and FDA certified medical device manufacturing facility.

 

 

FlexBeam is a premium device that is built to last. 

We have produced and shipped over 1000 units so far. Not a single customer has taken us up on our 30 day money-back guarantee. And the genuine stories of healing we get back motivate us to keep going.

We believe FlexBeam is a revolution in personal healthcare.

 

New York Mag - The Actually Convincing Science of Light Therapy
Glamour - Red Light Therapy May Actually be The Fountain of Youth
MensHealth - I Put Red Light On My Balls to Triple my Testosterone
Medium - Red Light Therapy Speeding Muscle Recovery for Athletes
VOX - Biohacking Transhumanism Human Augmentation
The Atlantic - Top Biohacks

 

NASA Red Light Research
Increase in Exercise Load and Reduced Fatigue
Improvement on Delayed On-set Muscle Soreness (DOMS)
Increase of Muscle Strength and Performance Metrics
Proposed Mechanisms of Photobiomodulation
​Infrared Light Excites Cells by Changing Their Electrical Capacitance​
Low-Level Laser (Light) Therapy in Skin: Stimulating, Healing, Restoring
Effect of Light Therapy on Gene Expression in Osteoblasts

And so many more, see our ongoing compilation here.

story:
Now, the next model PlatoGame is available!

 


The PlatoWork headset

PlatoWork is the first of its kind: A cloud based, plug and play, neurostimulation headset supported by an app. 


Your brain at its best  – when you need it 

PlatoWork can get you into work mode on days, where your brain just wont collaborate. Or increase your state of flow, when you're already on track with a task. Whether you need to study for an exam, block out distractions to meet a deadline, or come up with creative solutions to a problem, PlatoWork can help you get there. In the app, you can choose between four different modes, to accelerate different types of cognitive functions:

 

New product – known technology

The headset uses a safe and well-known technology called tDCS - transcranial direct current stimulation, which can increase cognitive functions by sending a weak current through specific regions of the brain. tDCS has been around for more than 20 years, but has been reserved for elite usage in closed settings such as army- and pilot training, and research labs at top universities.

 

Well over 4000 studies have already demonstrated that tDCS is a safe and effective way to optimize brain activity. Unlike chemical performance enhancers, neurostimulation with tDCS is not associated with any serious adverse effects. Links to further readings are provided at the bottom of the page.

Stimulating your brain with tDCS will only work if your brain works with it. tDCS primes your neurons to perform faster, but it only works, if you yourself activate them.

Reviews from real users

We’ve already produced, sold and shipped two earlier versions of the headset, now used by hundreds of people around the world. Their continuous feedback has been vital in helping shape the final product.


 

 

 

 

 

How to use PlatoWork

Put on the PlatoWork headset, use the app to select which mode you need, and for the next 30 minutes the headset will stimulate the relevant regions of your brain, while you continue working.

  



The PlatoWork app

Use the PlatoWork app (iOS/Android) to manage and track your sessions 

Please note that PlatoWork app only runs on:

Minimum version Android => Lollipop 5.0
Minimum version IOS => IOS 10.0

 


Development

After two years of development, the final concept for the PlatoWork headset was ready at the start of 2017, after 100’s of different prototypes, endless 3D prints, and testing in lab and with users. The current design has been shaped over the last two years, based on hand assembly and shipping smaller batches of first generation headsets to users around the world.

    PlatoWork is the result of thousands of sessions and hundreds of individual users. Their feedback has been a vital contribution in helping shape the final version of the headset and app, now available to you.
     

    Production/shipping stage

    The product is ready and is currently delivering in more than 70 countries worldwide! To ensure the quality of the product, we've chosen to produce in small batches, which is why only a limited number of products are available.

    *Please note that local taxes and VAT will be applied upon import to countries outside of the US and the EU.

    PlatoWork unboxing – made independently by one of our backers
     


    PlatoWork headsets packed and ready for shipping​

     

    Our story & team

    This journey started back in 2015, when the founders, Morten and Balder, decided that it was  time tDCS technology became widely available. Morten, a neurobiologist, and Balder, a product designer, have been friends and collaborators since they wrote their PhD’s together at Copenhagen Business School 10 years ago. 

    Today, the core team of PlatoScience includes a small but dedicated group of neuroscientists, engineers, developers, communicators and designers based in Copenhagen, Denmark. We are devoted to making neurostimulation easy and accessible to anyone, who wants to improve the way their brain works.
     

    Our vision

    To the ancient Greeks, a rich life was a life engaged in thinking: To be the best version of yourself was to be curious and strive to improve your mind. We named our company after one of the greatest thinkers of all time, because these ideals need to be made relevant again. PlatoWork is not just about enhancing cognitive performance. It’s about the gratifying experience of using your brain, the way it was intended. When we are fully absorbed in a task we are not just more efficient; we are in a state of flow – we are happy. Neurostimulation is a way to gradually take charge of your brain. It’s a tool for monotasking and a celebration of the things, we as humans are capable of when we insist, that our ability to think is what makes us who we are.

     

    Founders

    Balder Onarheim is a serial entrepreneur and former associate professor in creativity at the Technical University of Denmark, with a PhD in the crossfield of creativity and engineering.

     
     
    Morten Friis-Olivarius is a neuroscientist and serial entrepreneur in applied neuroscience. He is considered one of the leading experts on neurocreativity and holds a PhD in neurobiology and creativity from Hvidovre University Hospital and Copenhagen Business School. 

     

     

    Project risks and challenges

    We’ve done everything we could to ensure that the production runs smoothly. That's why we've decided to produce in small batches to avoid any problems with high volume productions. 

    Still the biggest risk-delimitation we’ve made, is to test PlatoWork among real users and continue to redesign the product based on their feedback.  

     

    Who can use PlatoWork?

    Anyone who is neurologically healthy, have normal skin and is more than 18 years of age can use the headset.

    You cannot use the headset if:

    • You have a scalp or skin condition (e.g. psoriasis or eczema) as tDCS may aggravate the condition.
    • If you have a neurological disease or condition. tDCS responsiveness and current flow may differ due to the condition.
    • Have any metallic implants in your head, including intracranial electrodes, surgical clips, shrapnel or a pacemaker - but not including metal in the teeth and/or jaw. The reason is that metallic implants may change the current flow.
    • If you have any doubts, please consult your doctor before ordering.

     

    Product details and specifications

     

    Recommended further reading

    We understand how important it is for you to be able to read more about neurostimulation and academic research related to PlatoWork. Below is a research overview of the most important studies with links to the original articles.

    Overview of the neurostimulation technique
    The review Physiology of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation from 2018 explains the biological and physiological mechanisms behind the effects of neurostimulation.

    Neurostimulation and learning
    Simonsmeier et al. investigated the effects of neurostimulation on learning in comparison to performance tasks in the meta-analysis Electrical brain stimulation (tES) improves learning more than performance from 2018. Here they show that neurostimulation during a learning phase has a much stronger effect than both before or during a performance task. They concluded that the effects of neurostimulation is stronger when used to acquire new skills. In fact, studies have shown that a new skill can be acquired up to double the normal rate if neurostimulation is used simultaneously.

    Boosting creativity with neurostimulation
    Compared to other sciences less is known about the nature of the neural mechanisms underlying Creativity. To 'create' as such is a multifaceted phenomenon and cannot be ascribed to one single mechanism. Instead it is better viewed as an interplay of many mechanisms. Lucchiari, Sala and Vanutelli (2018) have made a critical review Promoting Creativity Through Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) on the effectiveness of the different attempts to use neurostimulation to increase neuronal excitability in brain areas related to creativity. These studies were compiled under the following headlines: The promotion of self-focused attention; the disruption of inhibiting mechanisms; the enhancement of creative thinking; the promotion of artistic enactment.

     

    Credits

    Thanks to all our awesome helpers who’ve contributed to the production of this campaign!

    Michael Rosenfeldt - filming and editing

    Peter Klint - deck and still photography

    Chris Milne - deck photography

    Espen Guldbrandsen - deck photography

    Espen Hanstad Sørby - deck photography

    Daniel Rosenfeldt - speak, and music in testimonial videos

    Henning Vincent - sound mastering

    Jesper Vind, Fenris Motorcycles, Republikken & The Rabbit Hole - locations

    Orestes - filming assistance

    Tine's parents - babysitting

It’s a tool for monotasking and a celebration of the things, we as humans are capable of when we insist, that our ability to think is what makes us who we are.
 
Founders
Balder Onarheim is a serial entrepreneur and former associate professor in creativity at the Technical University of Denmark, with a PhD in the crossfield of creativity and engineering.

 
 

Morten Friis-Olivarius is a neuroscientist and serial entrepreneur in applied neuroscience. He is considered one of the leading experts on neurocreativity and holds a PhD in neurobiology and creativity from Hvidovre University Hospital and Copenhagen Business School. 

 
 
Project risks and challenges
We’ve done everything we could to ensure that the production runs smoothly. That's why we've decided to produce in small batches to avoid any problems with high volume productions. 
Still the biggest risk-delimitation we’ve made, is to test PlatoWork among real users and continue to redesign the product based on their feedback.  
 
Who can use PlatoWork?
Anyone who is neurologically healthy, have normal skin and is more than 18 years of age can use the headset.
You cannot use the headset if:

You have a scalp or skin condition (e.g. psoriasis or eczema) as tDCS may aggravate the condition.
If you have a neurological disease or condition. tDCS responsiveness and current flow may differ due to the condition.
Have any metallic implants in your head, including intracranial electrodes, surgical clips, shrapnel or a pacemaker - but not including metal in the teeth and/or jaw. The reason is that metallic implants may change the current flow.
If you have any doubts, please consult your doctor before ordering.

 
Product details and specifications

 
Recommended further reading
We understand how important it is for you to be able to read more about neurostimulation and academic research related to PlatoWork. Below is a research overview of the most important studies with links to the original articles.
Overview of the neurostimulation techniqueThe review Physiology of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation from 2018 explains the biological and physiological mechanisms behind the effects of neurostimulation.
Neurostimulation and learningSimonsmeier et al. investigated the effects of neurostimulation on learning in comparison to performance tasks in the meta-analysis Electrical brain stimulation (tES) improves learning more than performance from 2018. Here they show that neurostimulation during a learning phase has a much stronger effect than both before or during a performance task. They concluded that the effects of neurostimulation is stronger when used to acquire new skills. In fact, studies have shown that a new skill can be acquired up to double the normal rate if neurostimulation is used simultaneously.
Boosting creativity with neurostimulationCompared to other sciences less is known about the nature of the neural mechanisms underlying Creativity. To 'create' as such is a multifaceted phenomenon and cannot be ascribed to one single mechanism. Instead it is better viewed as an interplay of many mechanisms. Lucchiari, Sala and Vanutelli (2018) have made a critical review Promoting Creativity Through Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) on the effectiveness of the different attempts to use neurostimulation to increase neuronal excitability in brain areas related to creativity. These studies were compiled under the following headlines: The promotion of self-focused attention; the disruption of inhibiting mechanisms; the enhancement of creative thinking; the promotion of artistic enactment.

 
Credits
Thanks to all our awesome helpers who’ve contributed to the production of this campaign!
Michael Rosenfeldt - filming and editing
Peter Klint - deck and still photography
Chris Milne - deck photography
Espen Guldbrandsen - deck photography
Espen Hanstad Sørby - deck photography
Daniel Rosenfeldt - speak, and music in testimonial videos
Henning Vincent - sound mastering
Jesper Vind, Fenris Motorcycles, Republikken & The Rabbit Hole - locations
Orestes - filming assistance
Tine's parents - babysitting

story:
www.eveia.io

eveia - a connected Active Footrest to use everywhere

 

At the office, chair with wheels.

 

 

Outside, when reading a book.

 

 

In front off the TV.

 

 

 

 

 

Eveia AF is the first connected flywheel footrest, which allows to keep moving while sitting, either at work or in the sofa at home. Its unique design and ergonomical conception allows for a natural and effortless movement that removes the "heavy legs" sensations and reduces the negative effects of our urban and sedentary way of life.

At your desk or in front of the television, 99% of the testers used instinctively Eveia. Connected via bluetooth on your smartphone or on your smartwatch, compatible with HealthKit (iOS) and Google Fit (Android), Eveia AF helps you reach your daily objectives.

Eveia AF est le premier pédalier inertiel connecté qui permet de poser ses pieds au bureau, à la maison ou dans son canapé. Son design et sa conception ergonomique unique permettent un mouvement naturel sans effort pour supprimer « l’effet jambes lourdes » et de lutter contre les effets négatifs du mode de vie urbain et sédentaire. Installé sous le bureau ou devant la télévision, 99% des testeurs du produit ont utilisé instinctivement Eveia. Connecté en bluetooth à votre smartphone ou votre montre connecté, compatible HealthKit (iOS) et Google Fit (Android), Eveia AF vous aide à atteindre vos objectifs d’activité quotidiens.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

IMPROVE YOUR POSTURE

No more back pain.

 

AMELIORER VOTRE POSTURE

Fini le mal de dos.

 

CALORIES

Burns Calories Instead of Storing Them

 

CALORIES

Brûler des calories au lieu de les stocker

 

LEG SWELLING

Finally, it's an old stories

 

JAMBES LOURDES

C'est de l'histoire ancienne.

 

IMPROVEMENT

Concentration - creativity - memory and decision making.

 

AMELIORATION

Concentration - créativité - mémoire et prise de décisions.

 

Other BENEFITS

 

Compared to stationary sitting, the use of eveia AF increases your energy expenditure by up to 100%.

 

Par rapport à la position assise passive, l'utilisation d'eveia AF augmente vos dépenses énergétiques de plus de 100%.

 

 

MUSCLE STRENGHTHENING

the muscles you will strengthen.

 

RENFORCEMENT MUSCULAIRE

les muscles que vous allez renforcer.

 

 

 

The Facts about daily physical inactivity.

 

Les effets liés à l'inactivité physique au quotidien.

 

 

 

 

"you are spinning your legs one way or another, it becomes really addictive and it helps me concentrate longer"

« Vous tournez vos jambes dans un sens, puis dans l’autre, en fait ça devient vraiment addictif et j’ai l’impression que ça m’aide à me concentrer plus longtemps »

Emma, webdesigner

 

« To reach the 10 000 steps per day objective (WHO recommendations),  I used to make a detour on my walk back home. Today, I'm completing the rings on my Apple Watch at work »

«  Pour atteindre les 10 000 pas par jour (recommandations de l’OMS), avant, je faisais un détour pour rentrer chez moi à pieds. Aujourd’hui, je complète mes anneaux sur mon Apple Watch au bureau »

Oscar, salesman, commercial sédentaire

 

«I'm a medical assistant and I spend 7 to 8 hours sitting down. With the crowd coming at my desk I can't even get up more than twice a day. I feel my legs getting heavy, I put up some weight, I know it's not good for my health but what can I do ? My occupational doctor helped me improve my posture and my workstation's ergonomy, using magazines and an angled footrest. It's better but I'm still experiencing blood circulation issues. Since, I have tested Eveia for a month and I came to realize that my posture was less of an issue than inactivity. I did not want to return my eveia device back and have already preordered mine on Indiegogo. I can't wait for the delivery!   »

« Je suis secrétaire dans un cabinet médical, je passe 7 à 8 heures par jour assise. Avec l’affluence je ne me lève que 2 fois par jour environ, j’ai les jambes lourdes et j’ai pris du poids, je sais que ce n'est pas bon pour ma santé, mais que faire ? Avec les médecins du cabinet, nous avons travaillé la posture et l’installation au travail, et finalement nous avons bricolé une position avec des magazines et un repose pieds incliné, c’était mieux mais j’avais toujours des problèmes de circulation. Depuis j’ai testé Eveia pendant 1 mois et je me suis rendu compte que ce qui me faisait souffrir n’était pas la position d’installation mais plutôt l’inactivité. J’ai eu du mal à le rendre et ai déjà précommandé le mien sur Indiegogo, vivement la livraison ! » 

Virginie, medical assistant - secrétaire médicale

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

With a built-in anti-theft security system (compatible with Kensington cable).

 

 

Avec système antivol intégré (compatible avec les cables Kensington).

 

 

 

 

April 2019 update


We are making progress, the industrial project requires a financial investment of several hundred thousand euros, and we are raising funds from business angels and health insurance.
We keep you at the cost, between the time the funds are obtained it will take another 3 to 4 months to be able to deliver the 1st series.

We have improved many points, integrated smartphone charging, strap routing, and improved user experience.

Delivery will take place during the first quarter of 2019.

You can follow us on Facebook/eveiawellness,

we post progress news every week.

Thanks for your support!

 

Mise à jour d'avril 2019


Nous avançons, le projet industriel nécessite un investissement financier de plusieurs centaines de milliers d'euros, et nous sommes en train de lever des fonds auprès de business angel et d'assurances santé.
On vous tiens au coutant, entre le moment ou les fonds seront obtenus il faudra encore 3 à 4 mois pour pouvoir livrer la 1ère série.

Nous avons amélioré de nombreux points, intégré la charge de smartphone, le passage de sangle, et amélioré l'expérience utilisateur.

La livraison interviendra dans le courant du 1er trimestre 2019.

Vous pouvez nous suivre sur Facebook/eveiawellness, nous postons des news de l'avancement toutes les semaines.

 

 

 

 

 

 

My name is Vincent Fourdrinier, I work as an industrial designer for almost 20 years.
One day, while working, I asked myself the question about my recent weight gain.
I did some research, to discover that I spent more than 10 hours a day in a sitting position and that I met the definition of a sedentary.
And when I discovered all the effects of this way of life..... I got scared, it's a bit like reading a medicine leaflet finally... And I decided to act.I first bought a watch activity tracker.
I bought a big inflatable fitness ball, good for posture? Finally, I left it very quickly, uncomfortable to use.
I also invested in an electric sit/stand desk from IKEA, more than 700€, I only use it standing up to draw from time to time, I unplugged it, and anyway, unusable all day, and in addition, we burn only 7% more calories than a sitting position.
I tested the treadmill, too expensive, too noisy, it takes up too much space, abandoned.
So I thought, okay, I'm an industrial designer, so I'll do it myself.
And that is how the solution that you have before you was born.
And the name? It is a contraction of the Ancient Greek "EVEXIA" which means well-being and health.
So the circle is complete.
It's your turn not to be sedentary anymore!

 

 

Je m’appelle Vincent Fourdrinier, je suis designer industriel depuis prêt de 20 ans.

Un jour, en travaillant, je me suis posé la question concernant ma prise de poids récente.

J’ai effectué des recherches, pour découvrir que je passais plus de 10h par jour en position assise et que je correspondais à la définition d’un sédentaire.

Et quand j’ai découvert tous les effets de ce mode de vie….. j’ai pris peur, c’est un peu comme lire une notice de médicament finalement… Et j’ai décidé d’agir.

J’ai d’abord acheté une montre trackeur d’activité

J’ai acheté un gros ballon gonflable de fitness, bon pour la posture ? en tout cas, je l’ai abandonné très rapidement, inconfortable à l’usage.

J’ai également investi dans un bureau électrique assis/debout de chez IKEA, plus de 700€, je ne l’utilise plus qu’en position debout pour dessiner de temps en temps, je l’ai débranché, et de toute façon, inutilisable toute la journée, et en plus, on ne brule que 7% de calories en plus qu’une position assise.

J’ai testé le tapis de course, trop cher, trop bruyant, cela prend trop de place, abandonné.

Alors, je me suis dit, ok, je suis designer industriel, alors je vais le faire moi-même.

Et c’est comme cela qu’est née la solution que vous avez sous les yeux.

Et le nom ? C’est une contraction du grec Ancien « EVEXIA » qui signifie bien-être et santé.

La boucle est donc bouclée.

C’est à vôtre tour de ne plus être sédentaire !

 

 

 

 

CES Las Vegas 2018

 

Vincent Fourdrinier - CEO

Industrial designer for over 20 years.

 

 

Jean-Philippe Hervet

Business - Marketing - Development
